content.description: Climb the crack up into the shallow left facing corner. Continue up into a better crack to reach the top. The anchor requires tying off a boulder in the background or bracing with your body in a shallow groove on top.Â
content.location: One of the first really vertical looking crack climbs once you exit the ravine. Magister Ludi is #19 on the Topo Photo.

content.description: This is a larger cliff about 100' tall with all traditional climbing mostly in the 5.7-5.9 region. Their are no bolts on top and creative anchor building is necessary. Also, a walking off is required, which includes some scrambling. Due to the private land issue their are only a couple of fixed anchors on the wall, 2 pitons from many years ago and one bolt. The majority of the routes require tricky placements and some run-outs.
